plan_exercise_ob.description: A coding exercise allows your learners to practice a targeted piece of real work and get immediate feedback. We recommend you follow these steps: Plan the exercise, define the solution, and guide learners.This will ensure you frame the problem and provide the needed guidance with the solution in mind. Learn more about creating coding exercises
plan_exercise_ob.link: Learn more about creating coding exercises
plan_exercise_ob.title: Exercise title
plan_exercise_ob.learning_objective_placeholder: provide a learning objective for this coding exercise

related_lectures_ob.description: Provide lectures as a resource for learners to reference as they attempt the exercise in case they need more information or are unsure where to start. You can add max. 3 related lectures.

instructions_ob.description: Provide instructions so learners know what they're solving. Use accurate, grammatically correct language and avoid biases.

hints_ob.description: Hints will be unlocked after the second failed attempt of the exercise so that learners can get more support beyond the related lectures and tests. Hints are a way to nudge learners toward the solution without telling them how to solve the problem.

solution_explanation_ob.description: Solution explanation will be unlocked after the third fail attempt. You can paste your solution code here by adding a description of why the code is written a particular way or you can share a step-by-step solution explanation.

tips.item_3: If you’re intending to offer your course for free, the total length of video content must be less than 2 hours.

griot_description: Griot is an e-learning platform that makes it easy for students to learn from the best instructors in the world, and for instructors to share their knowledge and earn money.
about_us_latest: Check out our latest company news!
about_us_goal: Our goal is to share knowledge with the world.
about_us_goal_description: Find out how we can help you make greener choices for your career.
about_product_title: Make your learning easier with our products
about_us_imp_description: Whether you want to learn or to share what you know, you’ve come to the right place. As a global destination for online learning, we empower organizations and individuals with flexible and effective skill development.
about_us_wws_description: Griot is a growing e-learning platform with a large and engaged audience. We offer a variety of opportunities for instructors to earn money from their courses. We provide instructors with the tools and resources they need to create and share their knowledge with others. We are committed to helping our instructors succeed.
about_us_rb_description: Our blog is the perfect place to learn about the latest trends in e-learning. We're always sharing new and interesting information on our blog. Subscribe today to stay up-to-date! We share tips and advice on how to get the most out of your online learning experience. We also feature success stories from students who have used Griot to achieve their goals.
about_us_wu_description: Our courses are designed to be accessible and engaging, and we offer a variety of resources to help students succeed. We make education affordable by offering a variety of payment options, including monthly installments, so you can fit the cost of your course into your budget. We are committed to providing access to education for students in all parts of the world. We offer our courses in multiple languages, and we are constantly expanding our reach.

affiliate_close_account_ob.title: An affiliate who chooses to close their account will lose access to several benefits and opportunities. These include:
affiliate_close_account_ob.li_1: Earning commissions: Affiliates earn commissions by promoting products or services to their audience. By closing their account, they will forfeit the opportunity to earn these commissions.
affiliate_close_account_ob.li_2: Access to affiliate resources: Griot provides a variety of resources to help affiliates promote their products, including marketing materials, training videos, and support from the affiliate team. Affiliates will lose access to these resources once they close their account.
affiliate_close_account_ob.li_3: Affiliate links and tracking codes: Griot provides affiliates with unique affiliate links and tracking codes that allow them to track their sales and earnings. Affiliates will lose access to these links and codes once they close their account.
affiliate_close_account_ob.li_4: Affiliate profile and dashboard: Affiliates have access to a profile page and dashboard where they can manage their account, track their earnings, and access marketing materials. Affiliates will lose access to their profile and dashboard once they close their account.
affiliate_close_account_ob.li_5: Future affiliate program opportunities: If Griot launches any new affiliate programs in the future, closed affiliates will not be eligible to participate.
affiliate_close_account_ob.p_1: In addition to these specific benefits, affiliates will also lose the opportunity to be part of a growing community of passionate individuals who are committed to sharing knowledge and empowering others.
affiliate_close_account_ob.p_2: If an affiliate is considering closing their account, it is important to weigh the benefits of closing their account against the opportunities they will be forfeiting. They should also consider the reasons for closing their account and whether there are any other options available to them, such as taking a break from affiliate marketing or transferring their account to another affiliate program.
affiliate_close_account_ob.p_3: Ultimately, the decision of whether or not to close an affiliate account is a personal one. Affiliates should carefully consider their options before making a decision.
affiliate_close_account_ob.p_4: If you are sure you want to close your Griot affiliate account, please click the button below.

become_instructor_description: Become an instructor and change lives — including your own
become_instructor_reason: Connect with students from diverse backgrounds: Griot fosters a diverse learning environment, where students can learn from teachers from all walks of life. This can help students develop a global perspective and appreciate different cultures.
publish_course_control: Publish the course you want, in the way you want, and always have control of your own content.
teach_and_help_learners: Teach what you know and help learners explore their interests, gain new skills, and advance their careers.
expand_network_earn: Expand your professional network, build your expertise, and earn money on each paid enrollment.
Join one of the world’s largest online l: Join one of the world’s largest online learning marketplaces.

bi.p1: Griot is an online learning platform that allows anyone to share their knowledge and expertise with a global audience of learners. If you're passionate about teaching and want to make a difference in the world, then becoming an instructor on Griot could be the perfect opportunity for you.
bi.p2: To become an instructor on Griot, simply create a profile and start creating courses or lessons. You can share your knowledge on a wide range of subjects, from language and art to technology and business. Griot's user base is growing rapidly, so you have the potential to reach a global audience of learners.
bi.p3: As an instructor on Griot, you have the freedom to set your own schedule and work from anywhere in the world. You can also earn income from your courses and lessons, so it can be a great way to supplement your income or start a new career.
bi.p4: If you're ready to share your knowledge and make a difference in the world, then become an instructor on Griot today!

ir.l1: Create high-quality courses and lessons: Griot instructors are responsible for creating engaging and informative courses and lessons that meet the needs of their students. This includes developing a curriculum, writing clear and concise content, and using a variety of media formats.
ir.l2: Interact with students: Griot instructors are encouraged to interact with their students on a regular basis to provide feedback, answer questions, and foster a supportive learning environment. This includes responding to comments, participating in discussions, and holding live Q&A sessions.
ir.l3: Promote their courses and lessons: Griot instructors are responsible for marketing their courses and lessons to attract students. This includes writing course descriptions, creating promotional materials, and using social media to promote their work.
ir.l4: Monitor student progress: Griot instructors are responsible for monitoring student progress and providing feedback on assignments and quizzes. This helps ensure that students are learning the material and making progress towards their learning goals.
ir.l5: Become advocates for Griot: Griot instructors are encouraged to promote Griot and its mission of making education accessible to everyone. This includes writing reviews, participating in online forums, and speaking at events.

Our team created best opportunities for: Our team created best opportunities for you.

it.what_required_description: List the required skills, experience, tools or equipment learners should have prior to taking your course. If there are no requirements, use this space as an opportunity to lower the barrier for beginners.

cs_ms.title: Course Message
cs_ms.tips_1: Write messages to your students (optional) that will be sent automatically when they join or complete your course to encourage students to engage with course content.
cs_ms.tips_2: If you do not wish to send a welcome or congratulations message, leave the text box blank.

setup.title: Setting Up and Testing a Video
setup.p_1: Creating a quality online training course involves not only providing informative content but also ensuring a pleasant visual experience for learners. This means that your videos need to be of good quality, with clear sound and a sharp image.
setup.p_2: Before you begin, make sure you have the following equipment:
setup.li_1: Camera: A good quality webcam or digital video camera.
setup.li_2: Microphone: An internal or external microphone to capture clear sound.
setup.li_3: Lighting: Sufficient lighting to evenly illuminate your face and surroundings.
setup.li_4: Recording software: A video recording software such as Camtasia, OBS Studio, or iMovie.
setup.li_5: Editing software: A video editing software to make minor adjustments to your videos, if necessary.
setup.p_3: Follow these steps to set up your video:
setup.p_4: Find a quiet and well-lit place to record your video. Make sure the background is clean and professional.
setup.p_5: Set up your camera at an appropriate angle that frames you centered and clears your face. Adjust the focus and exposure if necessary.
setup.p_6: Place the microphone close to your mouth to capture clear sound. Check the recording levels to avoid saturation.
setup.p_7: Record a short test video to make sure the audio and video are properly captured and the lighting is sufficient.
setup.cs_title: Here are some additional tips for creating high-quality videos for your online courses:
setup.cs_li_1_des: This will help you stay consistent and avoid hesitations.
setup.cs_li_2_des: Don't stay in the same position throughout the video. Use static shots and pans to make your video more dynamic.
setup.cs_li_3_des: This will make your video more accessible and easier for learners to follow.
setup.cs_li_5_des: These elements can help make your video more engaging and keep viewers interested.

struc.title: Course Structure
struc.h2_1: Choose a topic you are passionate about
struc.p_1: It is important to choose a topic that you are passionate about and know well. You can consider your skills, personal interests, or professional experience to determine the topic of your course. Also, think about the demand for the topic to ensure that your course will be popular.
struc.p_2: It is important to present the subject matter in a concise and easy-to-understand manner for students. This means using simple language and limiting the difficulty levels. You can use concrete examples and visual demonstrations to help students grasp key concepts.
struc.h2_3: Divide your course into sections and lessons:
struc.p_3: Organize your course into sections and lessons to make it easier for students to navigate. Sections and lessons should be coherent and hierarchically organized to highlight the most important concepts first. This will also allow students to focus on specific topics and more easily find the information they need.
struc.p_4: Your course content should be varied to cater to different student learning styles. You can use videos, interactive demonstrations, quizzes, practical exercises, case studies, etc. Also, be sure to include concrete examples to help students apply the concepts they are learning.
struc.p_5: Interact regularly with your students by answering their questions and encouraging discussions. Discussions will help you understand how students are learning the material and give you ideas for improving your course. Be sure to respond quickly to student feedback to strengthen their engagement and increase satisfaction.
struc.p_6: Adapting to a new online teaching environment can be challenging. Be patient with your students and answer their questions promptly and regularly. This will help them progress through the course and stay motivated to keep learning.
struc.p_7: Once you have created your course, use different promotion methods to inform potential students that your course is available. Share it on social media, use paid advertising to target specific audiences, present it at online events, and any other method you find effective.
struc.p_8: Plan regular updates to your content to improve its quality and make it more relevant to students. Solicit feedback from students to get their thoughts on your content and use this as an opportunity to update elements that aren't working as well. Frequent updates can also help build student trust in your course and encourage new enrollments.

film.title: Film & edit
film.p_1: Before you start creating a video montage, it is important to have a detailed script that contains the different stages of the montage. This can be a written script outline or a chronological list of the scenes to be included in the video. This will save time and produce a more professional result.
film.p_2: Media selection is the next step. This involves choosing the images, videos, music, or sounds that will be used for the montage. It is important to choose high-quality files that fit the story you want to tell.
film.p_3: Organize all your media and files in chronological order or by category for easy use during the editing process. To do this, you can create folders in your video editing application or your file explorer.
film.p_4: There are many video editing software programs available on the market, each with its own features and functionalities. Choose one that suits your needs and technical abilities. Software such as Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, or DaVinci Resolve are commonly used for professional editing.
film.p_5: It's time to start building your montage by creating sequences and transitions. Sequences are segments of your video montage that tell a story by combining different elements such as images, videos, music, and sound effects. Transitions are effects that connect your sequences, such as cuts or fades.
film.p_6: Effects can add a finishing touch to your video montage. Titles and graphics can be used to add information or to animate specific parts of your video.
film.p_7: Music can set the mood for your video. Sounds can be used to enhance the action on the screen or to give a sense of realism. Try to find music that fits the mood you want to create for your video.
film.p_8: Rough cuts are useful for checking the consistency of your video. This allows you to see the entire montage before refining it. You can also identify errors and elements to change. The rough cut can include raw images, sequences, and transitions.
film.p_9: Watch your video montage several times to make sure you are satisfied with the overall consistency of the video, as well as each specific detail. You can note errors and elements to change for the next step.
film.p_10: It's time to finalize the video montage. This is when you can make the final adjustments and export the video in the desired quality and format. You can also add sound effects and audio mixes to enhance the impact of your video.

pt_tile.l5: You can also use “Mark for review” to come back to questions you are unsure about before you submit your test.
